title: Chelsea news and transfers recap : Done deal , Enzo Fernandez talks , flight to Portugal , Joao Felix hijack
body_text:
Chelsea are preparing for a busy end to the January transfer window after already completing six signings so far. Mykhailo Mudryk, Noni Madueke, Joao Felix, Benoit Badiashile, David Datro Fofana and Andrey Santos have all made the move to Stamford Bridge this month as Todd Boehly continues to splash the cash.
The Blues have spent over £450million since Boehly became co-owner and want to add a new central midfielder to Graham Potter's squad. Malo Gusto has completed a medical after Chelsea agreed a £26.3million fee plus add-ons with Lyon.
The French defender is set to return to the Ligue 1 side on loan until the end of the season before officially joining the Blues in the summer, along with Christopher Nkunku from RB Leipzig. Moises Caicedo and Enzo Fernandez are both of significant interest to the west London club but Chelsea may be priced out of a move for either player this month.
So, with that being said, follow all the latest transfer news and updates from the Blues in our dedicated football.london live blog right here!
WIN A PAIR OF PREMIER LEAGUE OR WOMEN'S SUPER LEAGUE TICKETS OF YOUR CHOOSING HERE
Fernandez latest
According to @gastonedul, Benfica's intentions are to keep Enzo Fernandez. Chelsea, who are making one last attempt, will have to pay the release clause if they want to sign Fernandez.
Soonsup-Bell switch
football.london understands Spurs are hoping to sign 19-year-old Chelsea striker Jude Soonsup-Bell this week to initially bolster their academy but with the prospect of a summer loan for the teenager, who made his Chelsea debut in the Carabao Cup last season.
Flight to Portugal on the cards
Ben Jacobs adds that Christopher Vivell is involved and Chelsea's owners have been directly engaged too in the deal for Enzo Fernandez. A larger contingent may fly to Portugal in person in the next 24 hours if things progress...
Request to leave
According to CBS journalist Ben Jacobs, Fernandez has stressed in 'strong terms' to both president Rui Costa and head coach Roger Schmidt that he wants to leave. The report states that the Benfica board is divided about accepting a structured deal.
Joao Felix threat
Barcelona are now keeping tabs Joao Felix with Xavi and club chiefs admirers of the Atletico Madrid playmaker, according to Spanish outlet Sport, via the Daily Mail.
Fernandez talks back on...
Chelsea have reopened talks with Benfica over trying to sign Enzo Fernandes, according to The Telegraph.
Hudson-Odoi injury
According to @SJohnsonSport, Callum Hudson-Odoi has suffered a hamstring strain that is likely to rule him out for around two weeks.
Benfica begin sly plan to resist Chelsea bid amid fresh Fernandez transfer issue
Benfica could leave Chelsea no choice but to pay the release clause for Enzo Fernandez as the Portuguese outfit explore ways to fend off interest in the midfielder. The 22-year-old has been heavily linked with a move to Stamford Bridge after impressing for Argentina at the World Cup in Qatar.
According to Portuguese outlet Record, Benfica are expecting the Blues to make a late attempt to sign the Argentine and are looking for ways to fend off interest in the final days of transfer window. So much so that the report states that the Eagles have been trying to increase Fernandez's release clause by €30million (£26m) to €150million.
It's also said that Benfica president Rui Costa has pledged a payment of €2million to the midfielder if he stays at the club until the end of the season. Earlier this month, head coach Roger Schmidt said he was confident that Fernandez will stay in Portugal until at least the summer.
Enzo Fernandez full story
Chelsea's transfer saga with Enzo Fernandez despite appearing to reach a conclusion earlier in the January transfer window could yet take another turn before deadline day.
The Blues focused their attention on Moises Caicedo after advances for Fernandez were rejected by Benfica who were demanding Chelsea paid the World Cup winners £106million release clause in full.
After talk of a move died down in recent weeks, Chelsea have been handed two significant updates on Fernandez as Todd Boehly hopes to add a new midfielder to Graham Potter's squad before the end of the window.
Read the full story here
Moises Caicedo full story
Brighton manager Roberto De Zerbi has reiterated that he hopes Moises Caicedo will stay at the club until the end of the season. Chelsea and Arsenal have both shown interest in the January transfer window but the Seagulls have remained firm on their stance that he is not for sale mid-season.
The Blues were the main party pushing for a deal sending a £55million bid for Caicedo which was swiftly rejected. Arsenal then emerged as possible contenders for his services with Brighton receiving a £60million bid for Caicedo on Friday, football.london understands.
That offer was also rejected, but upon learning of interest from north London, Caicedo himself released a statement on his future, hinting that he is hoping for a winter exit.
Read the full story here
Enzo Fernandez latest
Chelsea were unable to meet Benfica's demands earlier in the window of Enzo Fernandez's £106million release clause and now the portuguese club are contiuing to try and tempt off interest from west London.
According to Portuguese newspaper Record, Benfica are hoping to increase Fernandez’s release clause to €150m (£132m).
The Portuguese outlet also report that Benfica are expecting the Blues to come back with another offer for Fernandez ahead of transfer deadline day on Tuesday.
De Zerbi delivers Caicedo update
Ahead of the Seagulls fourth round clash in the FA Cup against Liverpool, two weeks after they beat Jurgen Klopp's men 3-0 at the Amex, De Zerbi was again asked about Caicedo where he revealed his stance remains the same.
"Moises is a good guy," he told ITV Sport. "We will see tomorrow and the next few days what happens. We hope he stays us with us until the end of the season but this is a question for the club and Moises.
"I think in life you can make mistakes. For everyone there are many solutions and we will see the best solution for the club and for him and for us."
Lukaku exit for Vlahovic
Chelsea could face a huge Romelu Lukaku problem in the summer once his loan from Inter Milan expires. The Blues forked out £100million to sign him in the summer of 2021 but the move has not worked out in the slightest.
The Belgian striker was loaned back to the club Chelsea bought him from but that temporary spell back in Italy has not worked out in his favour, with injuries plaguing his campaign.
However, Chelsea could have a great opportunity to get him off their books and sign a natural striker.
Calcio Mercato claim that Chelsea could offer Lukaku to Juventus and thus sign Dusan Vlahovic as part of a swap deal. It is stressed that this deal would be a difficult one to accept and money would therefore likely be needed in the deal to help convince Juve to accept the proposal.
Caicedo alternative eyed
Arsenal and Chelsea look set for an interesting final few days of the January transfer window as both clubs push to sign Brighton midfielder Moises Caicedo. The Blues sent a £55million bid to the Seagulls for Caicedo but saw that rejected, with the Gunners then making a push to sign the 21-year-old.
Brighton received a £60million bid for Caicedo from Arsenal on Friday, football.london understands. The Gunners submitted a proposal for the Ecuadorian international to Brighton, but it is thought that the Seagulls promptly rejected the approach.
Chelsea looked for a new midfielder in the summer and could only find a short-term option, signing Denis Zakaria on loan from Juventus. Understandably clubs are less willing to depart with key players in the mid-season window, and another stop-gap option option has potentially become available to Chelsea.
Read the full story here
Hakim Ziyech fresh price tag
Chelsea look set to face a frantic final few days of the January transfer window as the search for a new midfielder heats up.
Moises Caicedo is of course the main target but the Blues will face strong competition from Arsenal for his signature, that is if Brighton even allow him to leave this month.
Outgoings may also be high up on the priority list with Hakim Ziyech likely seen as a possible player to leave.
According to Di Marzio, the Blues are looking for just £17.5m in order to part ways with the 29-year-old who they signed in 2020.
Malo Gusto's first words on Chelsea transfer
Chelsea's newest January acquisition Malo Gusto has admitted the Blues' exciting project was his main reason for wanting to join the club. The 19-year-old full-back arrives on a six-and-a-half-year contract and will be loaned back to the Ligue 1 side for the rest of the season.
The arrival of Gusto takes Todd Boehly's January spending to £213.7million following Joao Felix, Benoit Badiashile, Mykhailo Mudryk, Noni Madueke, Andrey Santos and David Datro Fofana through the door at Stamford Bridge.
Upon signing for Chelsea, Gusto said: "I like the city [London]. I am really really happy to come here. I chose Chelsea because it's a very big club and I like the project. I am very happy to be here. Thank you for your messages. See you soon"
Why Malo Gusto deal was completed in January
Chelsea have confirmed their latest January signing, with Malo Gusto set to join the club from Lyon in a deal worth £26.3million. The 19-year-old has signed a six-and-a-half-year contract and been immediately loaned back to the French club until the end of the season.
As football.london reported earlier this month, Gusto had agreed personal terms with the Blues ahead of significant negotiations taking place between the two clubs. A fee being agreed by both clubs was never a mass issue, yet it seemed as though a winter deal being agreed was at risk of collapsing.
The Blues sent in an official bid for the 19-year-old last week that was rejected, before a £20.2million offer was proposed to Lyon on Tuesday which also was rebuffed, as football.london understands. Todd Boehly was prepared to return with another offer for Gusto, but then proceedings took a dramatic turn.
Read the full story here
Chelsea fans react to Malo Gusto transfer
Chelsea have confirmed the signing of young full-back Malo Gusto from Lyon on a six-and-a-half-year deal, running until 2030. The youngster is said to have joined for a fee of £26.3million, with the Frenchman returning to his former Ligue 1 club on loan for the remainder of the season.
The 19-year-old has made 15 league appearances so far this season, having been capped seven times by the France under-21s national team. Gusto offers plenty of promise for the future as well as a rotation option for Reece James, who has struggled with injuries over the past year and his absence is notable.
Chelsea fans have now provided their reaction to the news of January arrival number seven.
Read the full story here
Malo Gusto signs
January arrival number seven has been confirmed by Chelsea as Malo Gusto signs from Lyon
Read the full story here
Chelsea still hold Rice advantage
Chelsea and Arsenal are currently battling it out to sign Brighton midfielder Moises Caicedo and could face a similar duel in the summer for Declan Rice.
The Blues have held a long-term interest in the West Ham captain with Mikel Arteta now identifying the England international as his top target for the summer. Despite the current appeal of joining the Gunners as they sit top of the league, Chelsea could still hold the upper hand according to journalist Ryan Taylor on Give Me Sport.
Taylor said: “I do personally think those reports [Arsenal] are premature. I think you can’t underestimate the influence that Rice is a boyhood Chelsea fan; his entire family are Chelsea fans and he spent eight or nine years with the club before being released as a 14-year-old.
“I think in his head, there will be an element of unfinished business there at Chelsea.”
Moises Caicedo price tag admission
Chelsea and Arsenal look set for a crazy end to the January transfer window with both clubs interested in signing Moises Caicedo.
However, they face a tough task to do so with Brighton remaining firm on their stance that he is not for sale, instead upping their asking price to £90million. If an exit is not secured this month, it's likely that the demand and the high asking price will not be there in the summer.
Moises Caicedo transfer twist
Arsenal and Chelsea may have been handed a twist in the Moises Caicedo transfer saga by rivals Manchester United heading into the final few days of the January transfer window. Both London clubs have been heavily linked with making a move for the Brighton star this month.
The Blues were first, lodging a bid that was reported to be in the £55million range for the 21-year-old as a solution to their midfield concerns. The Seagulls swiftly shot down that proposal but that didn't stop the Gunners making their own offer as football.london understands a £60million bid was tabled and also rejected.
The Ecuador international has since taken things into his own hands as a statement was released on his future and desire to leave the south coast club.
Read the full story here
Christopher Nkunku signing helps Chelsea fix 14-year problem
Chelsea are set to welcome Christopher Nkunku to Graham Potter's squad in the summer after the Blues made a pre-contract agreement with the RB Leipzig forward, football.london understands. An agreement for Nkunku's transfer is said to have been finalised, with Todd Boehly prepared to activate his £52million release clause.
Chelsea have struggled in attack this season with a number of key players misfiring in front of goals this term. Kai Havertz has scored just six goals in 27 appearances this season, whilst Deadline Day signing Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has managed just three goals since arriving from Barcelona in the summer.
Armando Broja is set to miss the remainder of the 2022/23 campaign through injury, whilst Raheem Sterling and Christian Pulisic have also been sidelined since the start of January. The need for a world-class finisher is stark for all to see at Stamford Bridge and Nkunku's arrival could finally fix a key problem for Potter.
Last season, the France international scored an astonishing 31 goals and also registered 20 assists in 48 appearances for Leipzig in all competitions. Nkunku is currently the top scorer in the Bundesliga this season having notched 12 goals in 15 appearances, ahead of Niklas Fulkrig (11) and Marcus Thuram (10) - with the latter having been linked with a January switch to the Blues.
The Leipzig star could add to his tally once he returns from injury as he looks to recapture his stellar form ahead of his move to west London. Chelsea have not had a Premier League golden boot winner since Didier Drogba scored 29 goals in the 2009/2010 season.
Nkunku's statistics during his time in Germany prove his arrival could spell the end of the Blues' problems in front of goal and see them compete at the top of the league again next season.
Barcelona can hand Chelsea £13m transfer windfall as Todd Boehly agrees Malo Gusto signing
Chelsea could be set to receive a significant transfer windfall with Barcelona prepared to reignite their interest in Cesar Azpilicueta. The Catalan club were keen on signing the Blues' captain in the summer but Azpilicueta rejected their approach in favour of signing a new contract at Stamford Bridge.
Spanish outlet SPORT has claimed that Barcelona could reignite their interest in Azpilicueta in the summer transfer window. Despite signing an extension keeping him at Chelsea until 2024, a move back to his home country could be of interest if he’s guaranteed more regular minutes.
The 33-year-old is valued at €15million (£13.1million) by CIES Football Observatory, but with just a year left on his contract in the summer, the Blues may struggle to get in excess of £10million.
League Two job for Jody Morris
Former Chelsea coach and midfielder Jody Morris looks set to be unveiled as the new manager of League Two club Swindon Town. The 44-year-old was in the stands for the Robins crazy 3-3 draw with Gillingham on Saturday.
Malo Gusto completes medical after Chelsea agree £26.3m transfer
Lyon defender Malo Gusto arrived in London on Saturday morning to complete a medical ahead of a summer transfer to Chelsea. The Blues agreed a £26.3million fee plus add-ons to sign the 19-year-old before loaning him back to Lyon until the end of the season.
The Lyon defender has completed his medical tests ahead of becoming a Chelsea player, before returning to France until the summer. The teenager was due to feature for Lyon in their Ligue 1 clash against Ajaccio on Sunday but will now miss that game in order to complete his medical, according to reports in France.
Brighton set huge Moises Caicedo transfer fee as Arsenal and Chelsea have bids rejected
Arsenal lodged a £60million bid for Moises Caicedo had been rejected on Friday football.london understands. The Gunners submitted a proposal for the Ecuadorian international to Brighton, but it is thought that the Seagulls rejected the approach promptly. That follows a £55million bid from Chelsea which was rejected earlier this week.
The two London clubs have been on the hunt for a midfielder during the January transfer window. Chelsea had their eyes set on Enzo Fernandes in the opening weeks, but have seemed to switch their attention to Caicedo more recently with Benfica refusing to negotiate over the World Cup star's £106million release clause.
According to the Independent, Arsenal and Chelsea need to go to £90million to sign Moises Caicedo from Brighton, with the player's rebellious actions leaving the club's stance unchanged.
